->DO   NOT
add registry entries manually to be able to launch the game from the official site.

32 Bit:
Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Electronic Arts\EA Games\Battlefield Play4Free]
"Installation Dir"="C:\\Program Files\\EA Games\\Battlefield Play4Free"
"Language"="EN"

64 Bit:
Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Electronic Arts\EA Games\Battlefield Play4Free]
"Installation Dir"=C:\\Program Files\\EA Games\\Battlefield Play4Free"
"Language"="EN"

Well after some time I figured what Sagarzz meant to say;

Here is a more detailed description of what you actually have to do with registry editor.

Go to registry editor; (Windows key on keyboard + R) and type: 'regedit' without the '' and press Enter.

Go to:
32-bit: [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Electronic Arts\EA Games\Battlefield Play4Free]

64-bit:
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Electronic Arts\EA Games\Battlefield Play4Free]

They may not be there;
if they're not there: Create them.

Then create in the 'folder' Battlefield Play4Free a new String Value;

1st one:
Name: "Installation Dir" (Note: without the quotation!)
After that double click; and put in the following information:
"C:\Program Files (x86)\EA Games\Battlefield Play4Free"  (Note: without the quotation!)

For 32-bit: "C:\Program Files\EA Games\Battlefield Play4Free"  (Note: without the quotation!)

2nd one:
Name: "Language" (Note: without the quotation!)
After that double click; and put in the following information: "EN" (Note: without the quotation!)

NOW it should work;)
I mean, it worked for me:P

whoops;

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Electronic Arts\EA Games\Battlefield Play4Free]
